Class WorkflowScanner

java.lang.Object
com.scivicslab.actoriac.cli.WorkflowScanner
public class WorkflowScanner extends Object
Scans a directory for workflow files (YAML, JSON, XML).

This scanner only looks at files in the immediate directory (non-recursive). To access workflows in subdirectories, use paths like "sysinfo/main-collect".

Usage

WorkflowScanner scanner = new WorkflowScanner(new File("./"));

// Find workflow in root directory
File workflow = scanner.findWorkflowFile("my-workflow");

// Find workflow in subdirectory
File subWorkflow = scanner.findWorkflowFile("sysinfo/main-collect");
Since:
2.12.0
Author:
devteam@scivics-lab.com

      private void registerWorkflowFile(Path path)
      Registers a workflow file in the cache.

    • findWorkflowFile

      public File findWorkflowFile(String name)
      Finds a workflow file by name.

      Supports the following patterns:

      • workflow-name - finds in root directory
      • workflow-name.yaml - finds with exact extension
      • subdir/workflow-name - finds in subdirectory
      • subdir/workflow-name.yaml - finds in subdirectory with extension
      Parameters:
      name - the workflow name or path
      Returns:
      the workflow file, or null if not found

    • findWorkflowInSubdirectory

      private File findWorkflowInSubdirectory(String path)
      Finds a workflow file in a subdirectory.
      Parameters:
      path - the path like "sysinfo/main-collect" or "sysinfo/main-collect.yaml"
      Returns:
      the workflow file, or null if not found

    • getAvailableWorkflows

      public List<String> getAvailableWorkflows()
      Returns the list of available workflow names in the immediate directory.
      Returns:
      list of workflow names (without extension)

    • getWorkflowCache

      public Map<String,File> getWorkflowCache()
      Returns all cached workflow entries (both with and without extensions).
      Returns:
      map of workflow names to files
